wikipedia_page.main: Albert E. Johnson (17 July 1918 – 5 August 1998) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s, 1940s and 1950s. He played at representative level for Great Britain and England, and at club level for Warrington (Heritage № 434), as a wing, i.e. number 2 or 5. He also appeared for St Helens and Wigan as a World War II guest player.
